title: Jeffree Star reveals he made $20 million from just one palette launch
text:
Drinks on Jeffree, yeah? (Picture: Getty)

Jeffree Star has revealed that he raked in over $20 million from his most popular eye shadow palette and we’re honestly shook.

The beauty mogul, who has more than 16.1 million subscribers on YouTube, is the star of digital documentary series The Beautiful World of Jeffree Star made by fellow content creator Shane Dawson.

Investigating life behind-the-scenes at his make-up company Jeffree Star Cosmetics, the second episode in the series saw Shane grill the star on just how much his beauty business was raking in.

‘How much… do you think you take home for your biggest palette,’ the presenter asked Jeffree, prompting the beauty guru to ponder his answer.

‘It’s hard to say on one specific one,’ he replied, ‘I’d have to do a little number work.’

Finally offering up his answer on an iPhone calculator (how else is he supposed to count his millions?), Jeffree revealed that he had taken home a staggering $20,800,000 (around £168 million) from one palette alone.

Jeffree opened up to Shane in the documentary series (Picture: shane/Youtube)

Honestly, we had to re-watch that clip multiple times just to even comprehend that number.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Ever the humble star, Jeffree admitted that you could ‘probably shave a million or two off of that’ to cover the cost of his goods, which obviously makes all the difference (or not).

However, $20 million made off of stock costing a maximum of $2 million? Now that’s impressive.

First launching in 2014 selling matte liquid lipsticks, Jeffree Star Cosmetics has grown exponentially over the years, with the influencer and make up artist now selling a full collection including highlighters, eyeshadows and even tracksuits emblazoned with his logo.

Even after losing $2.5 million worth of stock in April, just imagine how much that must all be making him.

If you fancy lending us a tenner Jeffree, just let us know.

description: Jeffree Star has revealed that he raked in over $20 million from his most popular eye shadow palette and we’re honestly shook.
